About.title: About Us
About.aboutUs: Awdier Association is a non-governmental, independent, non-profit association, specialized in the developing and improving the agricultural sector and strives to improve the capabilities of farmers and increase their income and take care of the agricultural environment and improving the quality of production. It was established by ministerial order issued of the Ministry of Interior of the Kurdistan Region-Iraq No. () issued in //2023

BusinessDetails.name: Awdier Organization
BusinessDetails.tagline: Awdier Cooperative Association for the development of agriculture in the Kurdistan Region - Iraq
BusinessDetails.missionText: We empower farmers, boost productivity, and promote sustainable farming by improving income, providing advanced equipment, and advocating organic agriculture for healthier produce and rural economic stability.
BusinessDetails.visionText: To lead agricultural development in the Kurdistan Region by pioneering innovation, strengthening farmers, and ensuring a sustainable future through modern, eco-friendly practices.

Careers.title: Careers
Careers.description: Join our team and make a difference
Careers.intro: Awdier Association is looking for passionate individuals to join our team. We offer opportunities to work on meaningful projects that support farmers and develop the agricultural sector in the Kurdistan Region.
Careers.applyText: To apply for this position, please send your resume (CV) to:

jobs.title: Executive Director
jobs.description: Lead the organization and oversee its strategic, programmatic, and institutional development in line with its vision, mission, and core values.
responsibilities: Facilitate the work of the Board of Directors, General Assembly, and Audit Committee in line with best governance practices
Lead the implementation of Awdier's strategy and projects, ensuring efficiency, effectiveness, and quality standards
Build and maintain strong partnerships with local, regional, and international institutions, networks, and donors
Ensure the availability and effective management of human, financial, and material resources
Represent the Association in relevant forums and strengthen its public image
Prepare and submit periodic technical, administrative, and financial reports to the Board of Directors
qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Development Studies, Agriculture, Business Administration, Economics, or a related field
Minimum 10 years of progressive experience in managing NGOs, associations, or similar organizations
Strong knowledge of the agricultural sector, cooperatives, and social solidarity economy
Proven experience in strategic planning, team leadership, budget management, and multi-donor project oversight
Demonstrated experience in partnership development and institutional growth
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in Arabic, Kurdish, and English
High level of integrity, cultural sensitivity, and commitment to Awdier Association's mission and values
Willingness and ability to travel within the Kurdistan Region and other parts of Iraq as required

jobs.title: Finance and Administration Officer
jobs.description: Manage the organization's financial and administrative operations, ensuring compliance, efficiency, and institutional sustainability.
responsibilities: Develop and implement financial and administrative policies, systems, and procedures according to best practices
Ensure compliance with partnership agreements, contracts, and donor requirements
Oversee preparation and monitoring of the annual budget, project budgets, cash flow, and financial reporting
Maintain accurate accounting records, perform reconciliations, and ensure timely closure of financial periods
Lead audit processes, facilitate external auditors, and follow up on audit recommendations
Supervise procurement, disbursement, collection, and other financial operations
Support human resources management, including recruitment, training, and staff performance evaluation
Monitor fixed assets, inventory, office maintenance, IT systems, and logistical operations
Provide technical guidance and support to staff regarding financial and administrative matters
Prepare and submit periodic financial, administrative, and project reports
qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Accounting
Minimum 4 years of progressive experience in financial and administrative management within NGOs, cooperatives, or development projects
Proven experience in budget management, donor-funded projects, and audit processes
Strong knowledge of accounting principles, financial systems, and reporting standards
Excellent skills in financial analysis, documentation, and organizational management
Knowledge of tax, labor, and financial regulations in Iraq/Kurdistan Region
Proficiency in Kurdish and Arabic; English is preferred
High integrity, ethical standards, and attention to detail
Strong organizational, communication, and interpersonal skills
Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple priorities within tight deadlines
competencies: Strategic financial planning and budget oversight

jobs.title: Coordinator - Relations, Monitoring & Evaluation
jobs.description: Manage the organization's monitoring, evaluation, accountability, learning systems, and partnerships.
responsibilities: Develop and implement monitoring, evaluation, accountability, and learning systems for Awdier's strategy and donor-funded projects
Build and maintain data collection, tracking, and reporting systems to monitor progress and results
Support staff in data collection, documentation, reporting, and capacity building for effective M&E practices
Review and prepare technical, donor, and annual reports, ensuring high quality and compliance with donor requirements
Develop technical and financial project proposals in coordination with relevant teams to secure funding partnerships
Maintain a database of current and potential funders and oversee the organization's fundraising strategy
Strengthen relationships with local, regional, and international partners, institutions, and donors
Prepare communication materials to promote Awdier's vision, principles, and achievements
Support institutional development initiatives, including strategic and programmatic planning
qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Development Studies, Agriculture, Economics, Business Administration, or a related field (Master's preferred)
Minimum 4 years of progressive experience in resource mobilization, project design, and/or monitoring and evaluation within NGOs
Proven experience in donor communication and proposal development, preferably in agriculture, livelihoods, or cooperatives projects
Strong skills in data management, monitoring, evaluation, and results-based reporting
Excellent analytical and report-writing skills in English, with proficiency in Kurdish and Arabic
Knowledge of logical frameworks, theory of change, and performance indicator design
Familiarity with agricultural and cooperative sector programs is an advantage
Strong communication and relationship-building skills
Initiative-driven, self-motivated, problem-solving, and team-oriented personality
competencies: Monitoring, evaluation, accountability, and learning system management
Data collection, reporting, and performance analysis
Institutional development support and strategic planning follow-up

jobs.title: Technical Officer
jobs.description: Lead agricultural advisory services, cooperative support, research, and project development to improve services for farmers and strengthen agricultural cooperatives.
responsibilities: Design agricultural advisory programs in target areas based on value chain analysis
Develop methodologies and work mechanisms, including designing and delivering training programs
Supervise agricultural advisors in the governorates, follow up on their work, and enhance their knowledge
Conduct studies and research and prepare reports related to the cooperative and agricultural sector
Prepare technical reports with contributions from agricultural advisors on value chains for target agricultural products
Document and disseminate successful national and international models in agricultural advisory and cooperative sectors
Prepare project ideas focused on delivering services and support to farmers and cooperatives
Contribute to project proposals and partnership development to secure funding
Strengthen relationships with relevant institutions, universities, and authorities
Prepare technical and administrative reports according to the M&E system
Support the review and update of Awdier's strategic plan
qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Agriculture, Agricultural Engineering, Rural Development, or a related field (Master's preferred)
Minimum 4 years of professional experience in agricultural development, cooperative strengthening, or rural livelihoods
Proven experience in coordinating multi-stakeholder agricultural projects and value chain initiatives
Demonstrated experience in training, capacity building, and technical supervision of agricultural programs
Experience working with NGOs, associations, cooperatives, or government agricultural departments is preferred
Strong understanding of sustainable agriculture, agribusiness, and cooperative management
Experience designing and implementing value chain programs and market linkages
Proficient in data analysis, report writing, and technical documentation
Proficiency in Kurdish and Arabic; English is a significant advantage
Excellent communication, coordination, and leadership skills
competencies: Agricultural advisory program design and supervision
Project idea generation and proposal development

jobs.title: Agricultural Advisor (Agronomist)
jobs.description: Provide agricultural and cooperative advisory services, organize farmers into cooperatives, and support marketing and value chain development.
responsibilities: Conduct field visits to targeted agricultural areas according to selected value chains
Conduct needs assessments for farmers in target areas and value chain studies
Mobilize and organize farmer committees and leaders in target areas
Provide training to farmers using tools for best agricultural practices, including field days and demonstrations
Introduce and pilot new agricultural techniques with farmers and document lessons learned
Coordinate with ministry advisors, institutions, and experts to deliver specialized training
Raise awareness among farmers about cooperatives and their role in improving livelihoods
Provide logistical support and coordination for farmer training on cooperative establishment and management
Support cooperatives in the legal and organizational stages of establishment
Supervise the provision of financial and technical support to cooperatives
Monitor cooperative performance regularly and provide recommendations
Train farmers and cooperatives on basic agricultural marketing and value chains
Connect farmers and cooperatives with traders, companies, factories, and markets
qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Agriculture, Agricultural Sciences, Horticulture, Natural Resources, or a related field
Minimum 4 years of experience in agricultural advisory, community mobilization, or rural development
Direct experience working with farmers, cooperatives, or rural communities
Prior experience with NGOs, associations, or government agricultural departments is an advantage
Practical knowledge of crop production, irrigation, soil management, and pest control
Ability to train and transfer technical knowledge in a practical and simple manner
Basic skills in data collection and report preparation
Proficiency in Kurdish and Arabic
Strong communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to work in targeted rural areas

OliveProject.title: Transforming Kurdistan's Olive Industry
OliveProject.brief: A large-scale initiative to cultivate 415,000 olive trees and establish an advanced olive oil production facility in Erbil.

details.title: Sustainable Agriculture
details.description: This project focuses on utilizing sustainable farming practices, including modern irrigation techniques and organic production.

details.title: Advanced Oil Production
details.description: We are building an advanced olive oil extraction plant with a capacity of up to 10,000 tons annually.

details.title: Regional Impact
details.description: This initiative contributes to local food security, economic growth, and potential exports to Gulf countries.
